0.title: It's an Indian spy-thriller without bikinis & six packs: Karthi on 'Sardar'
0.article_body: Actor Karthi, while speaking about his upcoming film 'Sardar', said, "People keep asking me if 'Sardar' is touted to be a James Bond film, will it have bikini scenes and six packs?" He added that it is an Indian spy-thriller without bikinis and six packs. "So, it is for all family audiences," Karthi further said.

1.title: We should give credit to bowlers: Harmanpreet on India's Asia Cup win
1.article_body: Following India's eight-wicket win against Sri Lanka in Women's Asia Cup final, India skipper Harmanpreet Kaur said, "We should give credit to the bowlers and the fielding unit was very good today from ball one." Renuka Singh's 3/5 in three overs and Sneh Rana and Rajeshwari Gayakwad's two wickets each helped India restrict Sri Lanka to 65/9.

2.title: 2 people die after motorcycles collide in UP's Bijnor
2.article_body: Two persons were killed and as many injured in a collision between two motorcycles in the Rehar area in Bijnor, Uttar Pradesh on Saturday. The deceased, Alauddin (20) and Shekhar (19), were riding their respective motorcycles and died on the spot, police said. The incident happened at around 2 pm in front of Inter College Bhaguwala, police added.

3.title: T20 retirement not on my mind, it's a format I love playing: Finch
3.article_body: Australian skipper Aaron Finch said that he hasn't thought about retiring from the T20 format. "To retire from ODI cricket was quite nice. I think it took a little bit of weight off my shoulders," Finch said. The 35-year-old batter added, "But haven't even had it cross my mind about the T20 format. It's a format that I love playing."

4.title: IED weighing around 18 kg detected & destroyed in J&K's Bandipora
4.article_body: Security forces detected and destroyed an improvised explosive device (IED) in J&K's Bandipora district on Saturday. The IED, weighing around 18 kg and fitted with two gas cylinders, was found in close proximity to the Bandipora-Sopore road, according to officials. A joint search operation had been launched in the area based on intelligence received from the police, the army informed.

5.title: Was told 'Why're you dancing? Look after the house': Madhuri on becoming mother
5.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit in an interview spoke about how society's perception of her changed after she got married and became a mother. She said, "These things happen...there are many who say 'Now you're a mom, why are you dancing? You please sit, look after the house'." However, Madhuri added that none of these things ever bothered her.

6.title: Unidentified persons booked for duping Gurugram man of ₹4 lakh
6.article_body: Police have booked unidentified persons for allegedly defrauding a resident of Gurugram's Sushant Lok Phase-I. According to police, Satvinder Singh Tanwar deposited ₹4 lakh into three different bank accounts after he received what he believed to be a request for monetary help from his US-based friend over WhatsApp. Tanwar later learned that his friend's WhatsApp account had been hacked.

7.title: Champions of Asia: Jaffer on India's record 7th title in Women's Asia Cup
7.article_body: Reacting to India winning a record-extending seventh title in Women's Asia Cup, Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter and wrote, "Champions of Asia. Congratulations." He added, "To win seven out of the last eight Asia Cups is absolute domination." Virat Kohli tweeted, "Way to go." Chasing 66, India scored 71/2 in 8.3 overs to defeat Sri Lanka in the final.

8.title: 2 arrested in Mumbai for robbing ₹10 lakh by posing as CBI officers
8.article_body: The Mumbai Crime Branch arrested a hospital ward boy and a tiffin supplier for allegedly posing as CBI officials and robbing a 70-year-old man of ₹10 lakh. Police have recovered ₹3.25 lakh from the duo and are on the lookout for their three accomplices. The accused accosted the victim at a bus stop and took his bag containing the amount.

9.title: Mallikarjun Kharge joins Bharat Jodo Yatra in Karnataka's Ballari
9.article_body: Congress Presidential candidate Mallikarjun Kharge joined Rahul Gandhi and other leaders in the Bharat Jodo Yatra while it was crossing Karnataka's Ballari district. Kharge also took part in the mega public meeting in the district to celebrate the yatra reaching the 1,000-km milestone. The yatra will exit Karnataka on October 20 after covering 511 km in 21 days.

10.title: 3.4 kg gold worth ₹1.7 cr seized at Kerala's Kozhikode airport
10.article_body: A total of 3.4 kg of gold, worth ₹1.7 crore, was seized and two passengers who arrived at Kerala's Kozhikode airport were arrested, according to DRI officials. The gold was concealed in the body of the passengers who arrived from Doha, officials added. "The officers, acting on the information, mounted surveillance...and [arrested] both the carriers," a DRI statement said.

11.title: I'm happy being single: Rajev on reports saying he got married for 2nd time
11.article_body: Actor Rajev Paul, ex-husband of actress Delnaaz Irani, has dismissed reports that claimed he has tied the knot again. Reports surfaced after the actor shared a picture on Instagram where he could be seen dressed as a groom. Stating that it was a wedding sequence from his show, Rajev said, "I'm happy being single and don't want to get married."

12.title: Crops damaged due to unseasonal rains: Agriculture Minister
12.article_body: Agriculture Minister Narendra Singh Tomar on Saturday said that unseasonal rains have damaged crops. "The survey is underway and we are waiting for reports from the states to assess the extent of damage," Tomar said. Farmers are dependent on monsoon, which is unpredictable, he said, adding that despite all measures in place, cultivators are at the mercy of nature.

13.title: Eateries in Bengaluru can stay open till 1 am: Police Commissioner
13.article_body: After receiving multiple complaints about policemen forcing eateries in Bengaluru to shut by 11 pm, city Police Commissioner Pratap Reddy has issued an order allowing them to remain open until 1 am throughout the week. He has directed the police personnel to follow the government order issued in 2016 that allows eateries to operate between 6 am and 1 am.

14.title: Shami's estranged wife Hasin accuses TTE of misbehaving with her during train journey
14.article_body: Team India fast bowler Mohammad Shami's estranged wife Hasin Jahan has accused a TTE of misbehaving with her while she was travelling on a train from Kolkata to Bihar. She stated that the TTE used abusive language and also threw her mobile away. "Later I took help from the police and returned to the city under security escorts," she added.

15.title: Twitter user calls Big B 'weakest link' of 'Chupke Chupke', Dharmendra reacts
15.article_body: Veteran actor Dharmendra responded to a fan who tweeted that Amitabh Bachchan was "the weakest link" of 1975 movie 'Chupke Chupke'. The fan had reacted to a critic who, in an opinion piece, said Amitabh was "so nuanced and natural" in the film. "Stop running down Dharmendra for someone else's PR," the fan added. Dharmendra responded, "So sweet. Love you."

16.title: SC rejects Meta's plea against CCI probe into WhatsApp's privacy policy
16.article_body: The Supreme Court has dismissed Meta's pleas challenging the investigation ordered by the Competition Commission of India (CCI) into WhatsApp's updated privacy policy of 2021. "The CCI is an independent authority to consider any violation of the provisions of the Competition Act of 2002...[and] cannot be dissuaded from investigation," a bench of Justices MR Shah and Sudhanshu Dhulia said.

17.title: It's not all doom and gloom for us: SA captain Bavuma ahead of T20 WC
17.article_body: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma said his side is looking forward to T20 World Cup 2022 and how far they can go in Australia. "It's not all doom and gloom for us. We're excited...Probably not a lot of expectations around us as a team again," he added. South Africa have never reached the T20 World Cup final so far.

18.title: New ad features Ranbir Kapoor, Ananya Panday as a couple; fans call out their age gap
18.article_body: An advertisement featuring 40-year-old Ranbir Kapoor and 23-year-old Ananya Panday as a couple has been called out by fans over their age difference. "Entire ad I was waiting for a twist to show their relationship anything other than romantic," wrote a person. "I can't get over the glaring age difference," another comment read. However, some fans appreciated the pair's chemistry.

19.title: Stray dog mauls 3-year-old girl to death, injures others in Odisha
19.article_body: A three-year-old girl playing outside her house was mauled by a stray dog in Odisha's Balangir on Thursday. Deepa Munda died while undergoing treatment at a hospital. Reports claimed the dog bit her head and face, following which it attacked more than five people. Locals claimed it injured at least 12 people. Police said the animal hasn't been traced yet.

20.title: Congress' job is to create quarrels among people: Amit Shah
20.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, while addressing the people of Himachal Pradesh, criticised the Congress and said that the party's job is to create quarrels among people. "Himachal Pradesh is going to set a new custom that is 'ek baar BJP, baar baar BJP'…Congress cannot sit in peace without creating enmity among the people," said Shah.

21.title: Elephant found dead in forest in Chhattisgarh's Raigarh
21.article_body: An elephant was found dead in a forest near Khentabahari village in Chhattisgarh's Raigarh district. The carcass was found under Chhal range on Friday evening and a post-mortem was underway to find the cause of death, an official said. Notably, Chhattisgarh has reported 45 elephant deaths in the last four years. The causes range from ailments and age to electrocution.

22.title: Man impersonates Indian Air Force Wing Commander at Delhi Airport; arrested
22.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly impersonating an Indian Air Force Wing Commander at Delhi Airport on Saturday. The accused, Feroz Gandhi, is a resident of East Delhi. An entry passport issued in 2016, through which he had been getting easy entry at the airport, was recovered from him. Several incriminating documents regarding Air Force were recovered from his home.

23.title: Nitish Kumar's boat collides with pillar in Ganga river in Bihar, CM safe
23.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's boat collided with a pillar of JP Setu in Ganga river in the state on Saturday. The incident took place when the CM was inspecting ghats in Patna for the upcoming Chhath festival. Kumar and other people who were onboard the boat were safe after the accident, ANI reported. The boat sustained no significant damage.

24.title: Iran denies providing weapons to Russia to be used in Ukraine
24.article_body: Iranian Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian said Iran hasn't supplied Russia with weapons to be used in the Ukraine war. "We've defence cooperation with Russia, but our policy on...Ukraine war is against sending weapons to the conflicting sides and support an end to the war," he added. Ukraine has claimed that Iranian drones were used in Russian attacks in several cities.

25.title: Expired drug kills 10 child leukaemia patients in Yemen
25.article_body: At least 10 children being treated for leukaemia have died after being administered expired doses of cancer treatment in Yemen's Houthi rebel-held capital Sanaa, medical officials and workers said. The medication was reportedly smuggled into the country. Yemen's conflict, now entering its eighth year, has caused one of the world's worst humanitarian crises and has killed over 1,50,000 people.

26.title: K'taka govt fined ₹2,900 cr by NGT for failure to manage solid, liquid waste
26.article_body: The National Green Tribunal has imposed a penalty of ₹2,900 crore on the Karnataka government for failure to manage solid as well as liquid waste. "The total compensation comes to ₹3,396 crore…We have deducted the amount of ₹500 crore levied as compensation vide order dated October 10," said the Tribunal in a statement.

27.title: Sweden rejects joint investigation into Nord Stream leaks
27.article_body: Sweden has rejected plans for formal joint investigation with Denmark and Germany to look into gas leaks at the Nord Stream 1 and 2 pipelines citing national security concerns, according to a Swedish prosecutor. Mats Ljungqvist said a joint investigation would include legal agreements under which Sweden would have to share information from its own investigation that it deemed confidential.

28.title: BMC takes up responsibility of cleaning hospitals, to spend ₹74 cr
28.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has taken up the responsibility of cleaning hospitals for which it will outsource the cleaning work at seven civic-run hospitals to private agencies. The estimated cost of the project is ₹74 crore. "The paan stains on walls and trash dumped in the open have been a major challenge to cleanliness," a civic official said.

29.title: Indian economy projected to grow at 7% in FY23 despite global headwinds: FM
29.article_body: Indian economy is projected to grow at 7% in the current fiscal despite global headwinds, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. This is an outcome of the conducive domestic policy environment and the government's focus on key structural reforms, she said. "India is leading the world in terms of digital payments innovations with our transaction cost being the lowest," she stated.

30.title: 23 noise pollution hotspots identified across Delhi
30.article_body: The Delhi Pollution Control Committee (DPCC) has identified 23 locations across the city as noise pollution hotspots, according to a report submitted to the National Green Tribunal (NGT). The 'hotspots' were identified on the basis of real-time noise monitoring data assessed at 31 locations. Jahangirpuri, Karol Bagh, Kashmere Gate, and Anand Vihar are among the locations on DPCC's hotspot list.

31.title: Finch surprises Babar with birthday cake at T20 WC captains' presser, ICC shares video
31.article_body: The ICC has shared a video showing Australia captain Aaron Finch surprising Pakistan captain Babar Azam with a birthday cake during the T20 World Cup 2022 captains' press conference. In the video, Babar, who turned 28 today, can be seen cutting the cake as captains of the other 15 teams, including Rohit Sharma watched on.

32.title: Defending champions Australia are favourites for T20 WC 2022: Buttler
32.article_body: Talking about upcoming T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia, England captain Jos Buttler stated that the defending champions Australia are the favourites for the tournament. He said that the host nation are "slight favourites" in big tournaments as they know conditions better than any other team. Australia will play against New Zealand in their first match on October 22.

33.title: Varun criticises UP govt for not postponing UPSSSC PET amid floods
33.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi has criticised Uttar Pradesh government, saying that despite demands, UPSSSC Preliminary Eligibility Test (PET) wasn't postponed nor were adequate transport arrangements made for students to reach exam centres amid floods in the state. He also shared photos of crowds in trains and at railway stations. "'Ground realities' are perhaps not visible from 'aerial surveys'," he added.

34.title: GHMC officials to inspect eateries in Hyderabad to curb adulteration
34.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) will form teams of Food Safety Officers, Assistant Medical Officers of Health (AMOH) and veterinary officials and conduct inspections at eateries to curb adulteration of food. GHMC Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal warned that officials will be held responsible if adulterated food is sold. She asked officials to submit reports on inspections conducted.

35.title: IFS officer shares screenshot of fake job offer for '₹9,700 salary', warns people
35.article_body: IFS officer Parveen Kaswan tweeted a screenshot of a fake job offer he received via SMS. "Finally got the job offer. Now confused what to do," he joked while sharing the screenshot that read, "Salary is ₹9,700." "These days many fraudulent...agencies keep sending these kinds of SMS...Don't...click on the links. It can lead to data theft...or financial fraud," Kaswan added.

36.title: Kohli keeps on practising despite being told his time is up, video of reaction goes viral
36.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli kept on practising in the nets despite being told by a support staff member that his time is up. A video has gone viral showing Kohli's reaction on being asked to stop the practice. In the video, Kohli can be heard saying, "When Deepak Hooda will come, I will leave."

37.title: UK-based woman cheats people of ₹9.60 crore; arrested in Mumbai
37.article_body: A UK-based woman was arrested in Mumbai for allegedly cheating multiple people to the tune of around ₹9.60 crore. The accused, Nisha Dusara (34), was named in various cases of fraud across different police stations. However, the one filed in Malad in July this year helped police catch her, in which she had cheated two people of ₹72 lakh.

38.title: Germany made a mistake by siding with NATO in Ukraine war: Putin
38.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said that Germany made a mistake by siding with NATO in the Ukraine war. Putin said that the decision to cancel the Nord Stream 2 pipeline was a German one. "German citizens, businesses and its economy are paying for this mistake, because it has negative economic consequences for the Eurozone as a whole," he added.

39.title: PM Modi pays tribute to APJ Abdul Kalam on his 91st birth anniversary
39.article_body: PM Narendra Modi paid tribute to the country’s former President APJ Abdul Kalam on his 91st birth anniversary and recalled his contributions. "He is greatly admired for his contribution to our nation as a scientist and as a President who struck a chord with every section of society," tweeted PM Modi. He was born in Tamil Nadu's Rameswaram in 1931.

40.title: Reserved category certificate not mandatory for seeking govt jobs: Raj CM
40.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot approved a proposal allowing candidates from reserved categories to apply for government jobs even if they don't possess a certificate. Those belonging to other backward class (OBC), most backward class (MBC) or economically weaker section (EWS) can apply by submitting an affidavit if they don't have a certificate due to any reason, an order stated.

41.title: 20,874 cattle infected with lumpy skin disease in MP, 336 dead
41.article_body: As many as 20,874 cattle have got infected with lumpy skin disease across 31 districts of Madhya Pradesh till October 13, an official said on Saturday. Out of the total infected, 336 animals died, while 18,351 have recovered, added the official. Dhar, Betul, Morena, Ratlam, Ujjain and Khandwa are among the worst-hit districts, said officials.

42.title: Russian reservists likely buying their own body armour: UK
42.article_body: UK's Defence Ministry said that many Russian reservists called up to fight in Ukraine are probably having to buy their own body armour. The "modern 6B45 vest" was selling online in Russia for $638, over triple its price since April, it added. "Endemic corruption and poor logistics remain one of the...causes of Russia's poor performance in Ukraine," it further said.

43.title: World no. 1 Swiatek reaches her 11th semi-final of 2022 at San Diego Open
43.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek reached her 11th semi-final of the season after defeating American Coco Gauff 6-0, 6-3 in San Diego Open quarter-final. The victory is Swiatek's 62nd of the season and 40th on hard court. The 21-year-old will face fourth-seeded Jessie Pegula in Saturday's semi-final. Swiatek has won seven titles, including two Grand Slams, in 2022 so far.

44.title: Bengaluru-bound Akasa Air flight suffers bird hit, returns safely to Mumbai
44.article_body: Bengaluru-bound Akasa Air Boeing 737MAX that took off from Mumbai returned to its origin after a burning smell was reported in the cabin. It underwent an inspection after landing, during which it was found that the burning smell was caused due to bird hit, a DGCA official said. Bird remains were also found on engine number one, the official added.

45.title: D-Mart operator Avenue Supermarts' Q2 net profit rises 64% to ₹685 cr
45.article_body: Avenue Supermarts Limited, which owns and operates the retail chain D-Mart reported a 64% surge in consolidated profit to ₹685 crore for the quarter ended September as against ₹418 crore in the year-ago period. Its revenue increased by 36% to ₹10,638 crore as against ₹7,789 crore in September 2021 quarter. Avenue Supermarts' total expenses stood at ₹9,925.95 crore, up 36.93%.

46.title: BJP jokers will now call Global Hunger Index report anti-Indian: KTR
46.article_body: TRS leader KT Rama Rao criticised the BJP-led central government over the latest Global Hunger Index report, which showed a deterioration in India's performance. "Yet another amazing achievement of 'NPA Govt'. India slipped from 101st to 107th rank in Global Hunger Index. Instead of accepting failure, [I] am sure BJP jokers will dismiss the report as anti-Indian now," he tweeted.

47.title: 4 booked for cheating doctor in Thane, taking over hospital illegally
47.article_body: Four persons have been booked for allegedly cheating a 79-year-old doctor and taking over his hospital using fabricated documents in Thane, police said on Saturday. The complainant, who retired as a medical officer in 2002, established a hospital in Kalwa and decided to rent it out, police added. The accused fabricated documents and started operating the facility illegally, they said.

48.title: Salman Khan, Katrina Kaif's 'Tiger 3' delayed, to release on Diwali 2023
48.article_body: Salman Khan took to Twitter on Saturday to announce the new release date of 'Tiger 3'. The film, which was previously set to release on April 21, 2023, will now arrive in theatres during Diwali next year. Directed by Maneesh Sharma, it will also feature Katrina Kaif. 'Tiger 3' will be released in Hindi, Tamil and Telugu.

49.title: Modi added his caste to OBC list while he was CM of Gujarat: Lalan Singh
49.article_body: JD(U) National President Lalan Singh has claimed that PM Narendra Modi belongs to a "backward" caste and also accused him of duplicity. "PM Modi projected himself from the Extremely Backward Class (EBC) caste. I want to tell you that there is no EBC in Gujarat. When he became Gujarat's CM, he merged his caste into the OBC," said Singh.

50.title: Pune's Shivajinagar records 74.3 mm of rain in less than 2 hrs: IMD
50.article_body: Pune's Shivajinagar recorded 78.1 mm of rainfall between 8.30 am and 8.30 pm, with 74.3 mm between 4 pm and 5.30 pm on Friday, IMD said. Pashan, Magarpatta, Lavale and Chinchwad recorded 48.4 mm, 36.5 mm, 30.5 mm and 8.7 mm of rainfall, respectively, IMD added. Several parts of Pune witnessed water-logging and traffic jams following intense rainfall on Friday.

51.title: People like Rahul Gandhi will always remain unemployed: BJP MLA
51.article_body: BJP MLA CT Ravi on Friday stated that people like Congress MP Rahul Gandhi will always remain unemployed. The National General Secretary of BJP added, "Congress has lost all the states under...[Rahul Gandhi's] leadership." Ravi further said that the 52-year-old leader "must try some other country" as he'll not be able to relaunch himself in India through 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'.

52.title: Mumbai-based journalist manhandled by policeman in Kurla
52.article_body: A city-based journalist was allegedly manhandled by a traffic police personnel following an argument in Kurla, Mumbai on Friday. The journalist complained to the traffic cop near the railway station about the difficulty in hailing an auto rickshaw which led to an altercation between the two, an official said. Notably, a non-cognisable offence was registered at the Kurla Police Station.

53.title: UK police charge activists who threw soup at Van Gogh's $84 mn painting
53.article_body: Two women climate activists have been charged with criminal damage after throwing tomato soup over Vincent van Gogh's painting 'Sunflowers' at London's National Gallery, UK police said on Saturday. The Friday incident had caused minor damage to the frame but the painting was unharmed, the gallery said. The painting is estimated to be worth over $84 million.

54.title: List of cricketers who checked-in at NCA for injury rehab surfaces, Kohli doesn't feature
54.article_body: A list has surfaced online showing Team India cricketers who checked-in at NCA for injury rehab in the last one year. Ex-Team India captain Virat Kohli is one of the senior cricketers who doesn't feature on the list. The list includes Rohit Sharma, Hardik Pandya, Ravindra Jadeja, KL Rahul, Rishabh Pant, Ajinkya Rahane, Cheteshwar Pujara and Mohammad Shami, among others.

55.title: ICC names 'most explosive batters' who will feature in T20 World Cup 2022
55.article_body: ICC, on its official website, named the "most explosive batters" who will feature in T20 World Cup 2022. The list includes India's Suryakumar Yadav, who has a T20I strike rate of 176.81. Suryakumar is followed by New Zealand's Jimmy Neesham and Finn Allen, Australia's Tim David, West Indies' Evin Lewis, and South Africa's Rilee Rossouw and Aiden Markram, among others.

56.title: 15-yr-old Jaipur girl attempts suicide after blackmail by rapists
56.article_body: A 15-year-old girl in Rajasthan's Jaipur tried to end her life in order to escape the blackmail by her rapists. The girl was first raped by a man and later blackmailed into being sexually assaulted by four other persons known to him. The rapist further blackmailed her into paying ₹50,000 to not release video clips of the assault.

57.title: Several parts of Pune to face disruption in water supply tomorrow
57.article_body: Several parts of Pune will face a disruption in water supply tomorrow due to maintenance and repair work on the water pipeline between Parvati and Cantonment. The city's civic body's water department head Aniruddha Pawaskar said that leakage had been found in the water pipeline and it's necessary to repair it. Areas like Yerawada, Hadapsar, Mundhwa, etc will be affected.

58.title: Section 144 to be imposed in Hyd for TSPSC Group 1 exams on Sunday
58.article_body: Section 144 of the CrPC will be imposed in areas around centres conducting Telangana State Public Service Commission (TSPSC) Group 1 exams across Hyderabad and Secunderabad on Sunday. The curfew will be in effect from 6:00 am on Sunday to 6:00 am on Monday. Assembly of four or more people within 500 yards of the centres will be prohibited.

59.title: Military mobilisation should be finished in 2 weeks: Russian President
59.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has said that 2,22,000 out of 3,00,000 reservists have already been mobilised and all mobilisation activities will be finished in two weeks. Defending his decision to mobilise Russians, Putin said the front line was too long to defend solely with contract soldiers. Putin added that so far, Russia has no plans to launch massive air strikes.

60.title: Team India will prepare more while facing SL than WI: Irfan on T20 WC
60.article_body: Irfan Pathan said Team India will prepare more while facing Sri Lanka in comparison to West Indies during the T20 World Cup 2022. "The quality of the Sri Lankan side is much better compared to West Indies...Recently, they've beaten India in the Asia Cup," added Irfan. Gautam Gambhir termed Sri Lanka as a team that's peaking at the right time.

61.title: I hope Suryakumar becomes X-factor for India: Rohit ahead of T20 WC
61.article_body: Speaking about Suryakumar Yadav ahead of T20 World Cup, India captain Rohit Sharma said the batter is in good form. "I hope he continues to bat in that way, high on confidence. He's a confident player...plays fearlessly...uses his skill set efficiently. I hope he becomes the X-factor," he added. India will play their first match against Pakistan on October 23.

62.title: Woman accused in constable's murder during 2020 riots arrested from Noida
62.article_body: A 27-year-old woman, an accused in Delhi Police head constable Ratan Lal's murder during the 2020 Northeast Delhi riots, has been arrested from Noida after two years. The woman had fled her home after being named a suspect in the case, police said. "We found that she had moved to Noida and got married recently," police added.

63.title: HDFC Bank's Q2 net profit rises 22.3% to ₹11,125 cr, revenue up 18.3%
63.article_body: HDFC Bank reported a 22.3% surge in consolidated net profit at ₹11,125 crore in the quarter ended September as against ₹9,096.19 crore in the year-ago period. This was led by a 23% loan growth. HDFC Bank's net revenue rose by 18.3% to ₹28,869.8 crore for the said quarter from ₹24,409.7 crore in the corresponding period in the previous financial year.

64.title: Heavy rains cause flooding in Pune, residents blame Smart City plan
64.article_body: Several parts of Pune, including Deccan, Fergusson College Road, Jangli Maharaj Road and Apte Road reported flooding after the city received heavy rains on Friday. Blaming the Smart City plan for waterlogging, a resident said, "Footpaths are not built high enough at low-lying areas." "Authorities sealed many drainage lines as part of the Pune Smart City plan," another citizen added.

65.title: What are the rates at which employees are leaving India's top IT companies?
65.article_body: Infosys has reported an attrition rate of 27.1% for the July to September quarter, the highest among top IT companies in India. While attrition at HCL Tech remained at 23.8%, TCS reported a higher rate of 21.5% and Wipro posted a marginal fall to 23% compared to previous quarter. Attrition rate measures how many employees are voluntarily leaving a company.

66.title: Gurugram residents to be fined ₹500 for not segregating household waste
66.article_body: Residents who do not segregate their household waste before handing it over to the sanitation workers will be fined ₹500 from October 20, Municipal Corporation of Gurugram has announced. The ward-level teams will be conducting targeted and random inspections to find the violators. Residents are expected to segregate the biodegradable, dry and rejected sanitary waste into three separate bins.

67.title: Pakistani female DJ says she got rape, death threats after performing at music festival
67.article_body: Pakistani female DJ Neha Khan has recently revealed that she received rape and death threats after performing at Hunza Music festival last year. She had performed with five male artists at the festival. Neha said that she and her team were accused of sabotaging the local culture and the national norms of the Hunza valley, reports stated while quoting her.

68.title: Robbie Coltrane was like the most fun uncle I've ever had: Emma Watson
68.article_body: Mourning the demise of her 'Harry Potter' co-star Robbie Coltrane, Emma Watson wrote on Instagram Stories, "Robbie was like the most fun uncle I've ever had." The actress, who played the role of Hermione in the 'Harry Potter' films, added, "I'll really miss your sweetness, your nicknames, your warmth, laughs and...hugs. You made us a family...There was no better Hagrid."

69.title: Russell's viper snake found at police station in Hyderabad, rescued
69.article_body: A Russell's viper snake was found at Bahadurpura Police Station in Hyderabad on Saturday morning. The venomous reptile was caught by a volunteer of non-profit organisation 'Friends of Snakes Society'. The volunteer said the snake might have come out from the Musi River or the nearby zoo due to rains. The snake will be released in the deep forest.

70.title: India's forex reserves rise for 1st time in over 2 months by $204 mn
70.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves rose for the first time in over two months by $204 million to $532.867 billion for the week ending October 7, the RBI data showed. The rise can be attributed to a surge in gold reserves by $1.35 billion to $38.955 billion. The Special Drawing Rights (SDRs) reserve also rose by $155 million to $17.582 billion.

71.title: Cong will get full majority in Himachal Pradesh Assembly polls: Alka Lamba
71.article_body: Congress leader Alka Lamba has exuded confidence that the party will win the upcoming Assembly elections in Himachal Pradesh. "We are very confident that Congress will get a full majority. We appeal to all the citizens of the state to think and vote with contemplation because it is a matter of their as well as the state's future," said Lamba.

72.title: India defeat Sri Lanka to win Women's Asia Cup for a record-extending 7th time
72.article_body: India defeated Sri Lanka by eight wickets in the final in Sylhet to win Women's Asia Cup for a record-extending seventh time. Bowling first after losing the toss, India restricted Sri Lanka to 65/9. India chased down the target in 8.3 overs. India's seven Women's Asia Cup victories include four in ODI format and three in T20I format.

73.title: Salman Khan's fan says Sona Mohapatra has a 'eunuch's face', singer responds
73.article_body: Sona Mohapatra, who called out a channel for roping in Sajid Khan on 'Bigg Boss 16', has been trolled by a Salman Khan fan who said she has a "eunuch's face". "Getting d***s hard, might be...job of...women supporting...#SajidKhan and riding horses in #Salman Bhai's farmhouse, not mine," she replied. Sona had earlier criticised Salman over Sajid's participation in the show.

74.title: Aus are favourites for WC, floor gap between them, other teams: Shastri
74.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said Australia will be favourites for the T20 World Cup 2022, adding that there's "no question" about that. "I will put them...then there will be a floor gap and then you can start talking about...other teams," he stated. "The span has been...just about 12 months since they won the World Cup," said Shastri.

75.title: MSRTC to run 1,500 extra buses during Diwali in Maharashtra
75.article_body: The Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) has decided to operate around 1,500 extra buses from October 21 to October 31 across the state to cater to the rush of commuters during Diwali. Those above 75 years of age can travel free on any state transport bus and those between 65 and 75 will get a 50% concession.

76.title: Revised guidelines issued for development programme in Hyderabad
76.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has issued revised guidelines after the Telangana government increased the Constituency Development Fund (CDF) from ₹3 crore to ₹5 crore. This amount is provided to MLAs and MLCs for the development of their respective constituencies. As per the revised guidelines, the payment for development work will be done by the District Collector.

77.title: K'taka HC allows cab aggregators to operate autos until govt fixes fares
77.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has allowed app-based cab aggregators including Ola, Uber and Rapido to operate autos until the state government fixes fares. The companies can temporarily charge 10% of base fare as a convenience fee along with 5% of GST. The interim decision comes against the state government's directive which asked ride-hailing apps to discontinue auto services in Bengaluru.

78.title: Russia trying to kill Starlink internet service in Ukraine: Musk
78.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk has said that Starlink is the only internet service left in Ukraine, and Russia is actively trying to kill it too. "Internet fibre, phone lines, cell towers...have been destroyed. Starlink is all that's left. For now," Musk tweeted. Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov said Musk is among the world's top private donors supporting Ukraine.

79.title: Shouldn't country be freed from dynastic politics, asks Amit Shah
79.article_body: Addressing a rally in the poll-bound Himachal Pradesh's Sirmaur district, Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday said, "Shouldn't the country be freed from dynastic politics? PM [Narendra] Modi has done the work of ending 'parivarvad' in politics." "Congress, in the desire for power, hasn't been able to respect our heritage," he added.

80.title: Brothers sentenced to 40 yrs in prison for murdering Maltese journalist
80.article_body: Two brothers were sentenced to 40 years in prison each on Friday after admitting to the murder of Maltese anti-corruption journalist Daphne Caruana Galizia. She was killed by a car bomb on October 16, 2017. Known as the "one-woman WikiLeaks", Galizia uncovered networks of corruption in Malta and abroad. She was also known as a harsh critic of the government.

81.title: Brightest-ever gamma ray burst spotted, NASA shares pic of its afterglow
81.article_body: Astronomers spotted the brightest-ever gamma ray burst (GRB) that occurred 2.4 billion light years from Earth. It was likely triggered by a supernova explosion giving birth to a black hole and the burst lasted for more than 10 hours. NASA shared a picture of the afterglow captured by Swift's X-Ray Telescope about an hour after the GRB was first detected.

82.title: Woman's sexually provocative dress isn't a license to man to outrage her modesty: HC
82.article_body: Kerala High Court's Justice Kauser Edappagath observed that objectifying a woman based on her attire cannot be justified, adding, "Even if a woman wears a sexually provocative dress, that cannot give a license to a man to outrage her modesty." The court added that there cannot be any thought that women dress only to lure male attention.

83.title: We'll take a lot of risks without worrying about result: Rohit on T20 WC
83.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma said he and his team will look to take a "lot of risks" without worrying about the result during the T20 World Cup 2022. "Teams have become fearless...We're...looking to adopt the same approach," added Rohit. "140 used to be a winning total...[in 2007] but these days teams aim to reach there in 14-15 overs," he stated.

84.title: 21-yr-old woman accuses IAS officer, 1 other of gangrape in Andaman
84.article_body: A 21-year-old woman has accused an IAS officer, earlier posted as Chief Secretary in Andaman and Nicobar Islands, and one other bureaucrat of gangraping her in Port Blair. The victim said she was sexually assaulted on two occasions in April and May. An FIR has been registered and a Special Investigation Team has been set up to investigate the allegations.

85.title: We will not overlook any kind of military provocations: North Korea
85.article_body: North Korea on Saturday said it "will never allow any provocation by the enemies", referring to artillery fire by South Korea near the border. "[We'll take] overwhelming military countermeasures," a spokesman of the North Korean People's Army (KPA) said. On Friday, North Korea had fired a short-range ballistic missile into the sea and hundreds of artillery rounds near the border.

86.title: Nations must preserve vital foreign reserves amid rising US dollar: IMF
86.article_body: Amid a rising US dollar and depreciation of other major currencies, IMF urged countries to preserve vital foreign reserves for the future. In a blog post, IMF's First Deputy Managing Director Gita Gopinath and Chief Economist Pierre-Olivier Gourinchas said in such a fragile environment, it is prudent to enhance resilience. Notably, the dollar is at its highest level since 2000.

87.title: Yuvi & I would scare opponents: Raina on need for lefty batter in WC lineup
87.article_body: Suresh Raina termed the presence of a left-handed batter in India's lineup for T20 World Cup 2022 as "very important". "When Yuvraj Singh and I played, we'd scare the opponents...I am sure they are...thinking [about] it, but whoever they play, we've to win," added Raina. "A left-right combination can upset the rhythm, especially...[considering the big grounds] in Australia," he stated.

88.title: BJP responsible for ₹900 cr fine on Delhi by National Green Tribunal: AAP
88.article_body: BJP is responsible for ₹900 crore fine imposed on the Delhi government by the National Green Tribunal (NGT), AAP's Durgesh Pathak alleged. The people of Delhi will have to pay the price for the "inefficiency" of the BJP-run Municipal Corporation of Delhi, he said. NGT imposed ₹900 crore fine on the Delhi government over unprocessed waste at three landfills.

89.title: 3-storey building collapses in UP; 1 killed, 4 seriously injured
89.article_body: A person was killed and about four others seriously injured after a three-storey building collapsed in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh, police said on Saturday. The locals claimed that the building, which serves as a factory's godown, was in poor shape and rain and waterlogging in the past week had made the situation worse. Rescue operations are continuing, the District Magistrate said.

90.title: Kashmiri Pandit man shot dead by terrorists in J&K
90.article_body: A Kashmiri Pandit man identified as Puran Krishan was shot dead by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian district on Saturday, officials said. They added that he was attacked near his residence and doctors declared him brought dead after he was shifted to a Shopian hospital. The area has been cordoned off.

91.title: Hindutva not the antidote: Chidambaram on India's global hunger ranking
91.article_body: After India's rank on Global Hunger Index (GHI) 2022 dropped to 107th position, Congress leader P Chidambaram on Saturday tweeted, "When will [PM Narendra Modi] address real issues like malnutrition, hunger, and stunting and wasting among children?" Adding that India's score has worsened since 2014, he said, "Hindutva, imposing Hindi and spreading hate are not the antidote to hunger."

92.title: HDFC-HDFC Bank merger gets NCLT approval for shareholders' meet
92.article_body: The NCLT gave its nod for holding a shareholders' meeting for seeking approval for the proposed merger of HDFC Limited with HDFC Bank. The meeting will be convened on November 25. The deal is valued at about $40 billion. HDFC Limited also received SEBI's approval for the transfer of HDFC Property Ventures Limited, its wholly-owned subsidiary, to HDFC Bank.

93.title: Instagram introduces AI-powered age verification process in India
93.article_body: Instagram has announced that it is expanding the testing options for its AI-powered age verification feature to India and Brazil. The feature will allow users to upload a video of themselves, which Instagram runs through an AI system to determine whether the user is aged 18 or older. Meta has partnered with Yoti that specialises in AI-based online age verification.

94.title: Apple's mixed reality headset to scan eyes for payments: Report
94.article_body: Apple's rumored virtual and augmented reality headset will reportedly have the ability to scan eyes to allow users to sign into their accounts and make payments. The feature will make it easier for multiple people to use the same device, The Information reported. The headset will also have downward-facing cameras to capture the leg movement of users, the report stated.

95.title: TN vigilance dept seizes ₹1.12 cr unaccounted cash in govt office raids
95.article_body: Tamil Nadu's Vigilance and Anti-Corruption department conducted raids on 27 government offices that belonged to 16 departments. A total of ₹1.12 crore unaccounted cash was seized, out of which ₹75 lakh was seized from the guest house of the Tiruvarur Highways Department. Officials said that ₹8.87 lakh was seized from the office of the Assistant Director, Highways Namakkal.

96.title: Probe non-payment of dividends by Cairn India to Cairn UK: SC to SEBI
96.article_body: The Supreme Court asked the SEBI to hold an inquiry into the non-payment of over ₹340-crore dividends by Cairn India to Cairn UK Holdings within six months. The Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT) had in July quashed SEBI's order rejecting Cairn UK's complaint for non-payment of dividends from Cairn India. Cairn India merged with Vedanta Limited in April 2017.

97.title: Pivotal to break shackles of colonialism by removing regressive laws: PM
97.article_body: PM Modi pitched for ease of living and ease of justice during the inaugural session of the All India Conference of Law Ministers and Law Secretaries. "Delay in justice is one of the challenges. It's important for us to break the shackles of colonialism by removing regressive colonial laws, then only India can progress in true sense," said the PM.

98.title: Amul hikes milk prices by ₹2 per litre in all states except Gujarat
98.article_body: Amul on Saturday announced that it is increasing the prices of full cream milk and buffalo milk by ₹2 per litre. The new price will be applicable in all states except Gujarat, RS Sodhi, the MD of Gujarat Cooperative Milk Marketing Federation, said. With the hike, Amul's full cream milk will now cost ₹63 per litre, up from ₹61 earlier.

99.title: Centre, 6 states get NHRC notice over Devadasi system in temples
99.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) has sought reports from the Centre and six states on actions taken against the "continued menace of Devadasi system in various temples". The six states include Karnataka, Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Andhra Pradesh, Telangana and Maharashtra. "Victims of this malpractice are…sexually exploited by men, impregnated and left on their fate," noted the NHRC.

100.title: 11-year-old boy sexually assaulted by cleric at madrasa in Delhi
100.article_body: A cleric was arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting an 11-year-old boy at a madrasa in Delhi. According to the boy's mother, he had been going to the madrasa to study for four years but stopped last month, DCP (Northeast) said. The accused had also threatened the boy, police said. The boy reportedly told his mother about the ordeal on Thursday.

101.title: UK PM Liz Truss appoints Jeremy Hunt as new Finance Minister
101.article_body: UK Prime Minister Liz Truss on Friday appointed Jeremy Hunt, who has previously served as Health Secretary and Foreign Secretary, as the country's new Finance Minister. His predecessor Kwasi Kwarteng was sacked by Truss after less than six weeks on the job. Notably, Hunt backed Truss's rival former chancellor Rishi Sunak in the Tory leadership race early this year.

102.title: SC suspends Bombay HC order acquitting ex-DU professor GN Saibaba in Maoist links case
102.article_body: The Supreme Court has suspended the impugned judgment and order of the Bombay High Court acquitting former Delhi University Professor GN Saibaba and others in a case relating to their alleged Maoist links. "High Court has not considered the merits. The HC discharged the accused only on the ground that the sanction was invalid," the top court noted.

103.title: India unlikely to be hit as hard by global recession as other nations: SBI Chief
103.article_body: The impact of global recession is unlikely to hit India as hard as compared to other countries, SBI Chairman Dinesh Khara said. With a projected growth rate of 6.8% and inflation "much under control", India is doing reasonably well, he said. "Indian economy's beta factor would be much lower" than economies that have a significant component of export, he added.

104.title: Meta to shut Instant Articles on Facebook by April 2023: Report
104.article_body: Meta will shut its Instant Articles format on Facebook by April 2023 as the company aims to focus on TikTok-like offerings, Axios reported. With this step, news publishers will get six months to re-adjust their Facebook strategies. Earlier this month, Meta announced that it will shut its newsletter product called Bulletin for creators and writers by early 2023.

105.title: Nikhil Chinapa shares video of cockroach on Vistara flight, says 'sanitise your plane'
105.article_body: DJ Nikhil Chinapa has asked Vistara airline to stop sending him "unsolicited messages" and shared a screenshot of a Vistara message providing him sanitised cabs to travel in Mumbai. He then shared a video of a cockroach in a Vistara flight and tweeted, "It's funny you mention providing sanitised cabs. Perhaps start with sanitising your planes first."

106.title: Screams fishy: Jet Airways CEO on viral pic of cockroach in Vistara flight meal
106.article_body: After a passenger tweeted pictures claiming that he found a cockroach in the meal served on Air Vistara flight, Jet Airways CEO Sanjiv Kapoor said it "screams fishy". Noting that the passenger posted the photos two months after his flight, Kapoor called it a "hit-job". Vistara's probe found that the brown particle in meal was "a sautéd piece of ginger".

107.title: Whenever we meet, we just ask 'How are things at home?': Rohit on chat with Pak's Babar
107.article_body: Talking about his interaction with Pakistan captain Babar Azam whenever they meet, India captain Rohit Sharma said, "We just ask, 'How are things at home?' 'How's the family?' We just talk about that." He added, "Our last generation also said that we talk about our families, life, which new car you've bought, which new car you are about to buy."

108.title: NASA's SpaceX Crew-4 astronauts return to Earth after 170 days
108.article_body: NASA's SpaceX Crew-4 mission astronauts have safely returned to Earth from International Space Station. A SpaceX capsule, carrying three NASA astronauts and one European Space Agency's astronaut, splashed down in the Atlantic Ocean off the coast of Florida on Friday. The astronauts returned after spending 170 days in orbit, NASA said. The mission was launched on April 27.

109.title: 32,000 compliances removed in 8 years to improve ease of living: PM
109.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday said that his government removed about 32,000 compliances in the last eight years to improve ease of living. "It is important for us to break the shackles of colonialism by removing regressing colonial laws," he said, addressing the inaugural session of the All India Conference of Law Ministers and Secretaries.

110.title: UP CM Yogi's convoy gives way to ambulance with critical patient
110.article_body: Under Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath's orders, an ambulance which was caught in a traffic jam in Varanasi due to VIP protocol, as the CM's convoy was on the way, was allowed to pass on priority. The ambulance had a critical female patient on board who "needed immediate medical attention", the district's Police Commissioner said. The incident occurred on Friday.

111.title: Centre pulling money out of common man's pockets: Bhupesh Baghel
111.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel criticised the Centre over inflation and alleged that the government is pulling money out of common man's pockets. "They have increased the prices of petrol and diesel. Now they've imposed GST as well, 5% on 'rotis' and 18% on 'parathas'…Make Congress win in Himachal Pradesh by a 3/4th majority," said Baghel.

112.title: Former Pak chief justice shot dead in targeted firing outside mosque
112.article_body: A former High Court Chief Justice of Pakistan's Balochistan province was shot dead as he came out of a mosque after offering prayers on Friday evening, police officials said. Muhammad Noor Meskanzai died while he was being taken to a hospital in Quetta. Police have launched an investigation to find the motive behind the targeted attack.

113.title: 14-yr-old girl forced to remove clothes by teacher, sets herself on fire in Jharkhand
113.article_body: A 14-year-old Class 9 student studying at a girls' school in Jharkhand's Jamshedpur set herself on fire on Friday allegedly after she was forcibly made to remove clothes by a teacher. She is reportedly in critical condition. She told police that the woman invigilator made her remove clothes to find out if she was hiding paper chits in her uniform.

114.title: What is the format of T20 World Cup 2022?
114.article_body: T20 World Cup 2022 will commence with Round 1 tomorrow. Round 1 will be played between Sri Lanka, West Indies and six teams from 2022 Qualifiers in a two-group round-robin format. Top two teams from each group will join eight automatic qualifiers in Super 12 stage, which'll see two groups of six teams competing in a round-robin format.

115.title: Hours after loan default notice, Kerala man wins ₹70 lakh lottery
115.article_body: On October 12, Pookunju, a fish seller from Kerala's Kollam, received a bank notice of attachment for his house for failing to repay a loan of ₹9 lakh. His wife said they didn't know what to do and were wondering whether to sell their house. However, Pookunju had bought a lottery ticket earlier that day. It won him ₹70 lakh.

116.title: Court grants bail to main accused in Jahangirpuri violence case
116.article_body: A Delhi court granted bail to Tabrez, the main accused in the April Jahangirpuri violence case. "It'll take a long time to conclude the trial...no purpose would be served to keep the accused in judicial custody," the court said. Tabrez and his associate had allegedly recruited others to "take revenge for deaths of their community people during the 2020 riots".

117.title: ISRO's heaviest rocket to launch UK startup OneWeb's 36 satellites
117.article_body: The Indian Space Research Organisation's (ISRO) heaviest rocket, LVM3, will launch 36 broadband satellites of the British startup OneWeb in LVM3 – M2/OneWeb India-1 Mission on October 23. The mission, which will be launched from spaceport in Andhra Pradesh's Sriharikota, will make LVM3 enter the global commercial launch service market. India's Bharti Enterprises is a major investor in OneWeb.

118.title: India drops to 107th rank in Global Hunger Index 2022, behind Pakistan & Bangladesh
118.article_body: India has slipped six places on Global Hunger Index 2022 to take 107th position out of 121 countries ranked. With a score of 29.1, the index's publishers Concern Worldwide and Welthungerhilfe have labelled the level of hunger in India as "serious". Meanwhile, Pakistan (99), Sri Lanka (64), Bangladesh (84), Nepal (81) and Myanmar (71) have been ranked above India.

119.title: I already have my XI for Pakistan match: Rohit Sharma on T20 World Cup 2022 clash
119.article_body: During the pre-T20 World Cup 2022 press conference, Team India captain Rohit Sharma said that he already has his XI for the match against Pakistan, which will take place on October 23. "I don't believe in last-minute decisions," Rohit said, adding that the players have also been informed about the playing XI.

120.title: Pics of Rohit Sharma, Babar Azam from T20 World Cup 2022 photoshoot go viral
120.article_body: Pictures of Team India captain Rohit Sharma and Pakistan captain Babar Azam posing together in a photoshoot ahead of T20 World Cup 2022 have gone viral. India will face Pakistan in their first match of the 16-team tournament on October 23. The match will take place at Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG).

121.title: 21-yr-old wanting escort job loses ₹76,500 to fraudster in Mumbai
121.article_body: A 21-year-old man who wanted to work as a male escort was conned by a fraudster into losing ₹76,500 on the pretext of paying various taxes and charges to join the services in Mumbai. According to police, the complainant works for a car wash company in Chembur. Due to less income, he began looking for alternate options to earn money.

122.title: Indian man serves free food in Ukraine, says 'Made good money here, now we're spending'
122.article_body: An Indian man is serving free meals to hundreds of people daily in Ukraine amid war. "We have made good money here, in Ukraine, so we are now spending it on people," Kuldeep Kumar, who runs New Bombay Palace restaurant in Kyiv, said. "My family is here. They're all Ukrainians. These are tough times...so we are helping people," he added.

123.title: Pakistan is one of the most dangerous nations in the world: US President
123.article_body: During a press briefing, US President Joe Biden called Pakistan "one of the most dangerous nations in the world". While talking about Chinese President Xi Jinping, he stated, "This is a guy who understands what he wants but has...enormous array of problems. How do we handle that? How do we handle that relative to what's going on in Russia...[and] Pakistan?"

124.title: Eight flights diverted from Mumbai airport due to heavy rainfall
124.article_body: Eight flights were diverted from Mumbai to nearby airports on Friday due to heavy rainfall and low visibility conditions. Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA) notified all passengers of flight delays and provided refreshments to those waiting to board. Several parts of Mumbai, especially the eastern suburbs, received heavy rains on Friday evening.

125.title: Woman gets stuck in traffic, gives birth inside car in Gurugram
125.article_body: A woman gave birth to her baby boy inside a car after getting stuck in traffic while on the way to a hospital in Gurugram. The woman's mother-in-law said that they were stuck in traffic for about 30 minutes. The woman, who later reportedly reached the hospital in 45 minutes, and her baby boy are in healthy condition.

126.title: Fake currency notes with ₹2 lakh face value seized in Pune; 3 held
126.article_body: Directorate of Revenue Intelligence officers have seized fake Indian currency notes of ₹500 denomination with a face value of ₹2 lakh in Pune and arrested three people. The arrests were made after officers caught one of the accused, who was riding a motorcycle, with fake currency. An investigation has revealed that the fake currency was smuggled into India from Bangladesh.

127.title: Wipro senior exec Angan Guha quits, 5th senior-level exit in 2 months: Report
127.article_body: Angan Guha, a senior Wipro executive who was overseeing a third of the company's overall business, has moved out of the firm, Mint reported. Guha is the fifth senior-level executive to leave the Bengaluru-headquartered firm in the past two months. Guha was directly responsible for the largest share of Wipro's business, Americas 2 Strategic Market Unit.

128.title: ICC shares pic of all 16 captains ahead of T20 World Cup
128.article_body: The International Cricket Council (ICC) on Saturday shared a picture of all 16 captains of the teams participating in the T20 World Cup, starting on October 16. "All the 16 captains in one frame," the ICC tweeted with picture. The world cricket's governing body also shared a selfie taken by the 16 players.

129.title: 'Make-in-India' record-breaker: Piyush Goyal as phone exports hit $1 bn in Sept
129.article_body: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal lauded the government's production-linked incentive (PLI) scheme after a report claimed that India exported mobile phones worth $1 billion in September, setting a new record. "'Make-in-India' record-breaker," tweeted Goyal. Notably, the previous monthly record for mobile phone exports from India stood at $770 million in December 2021, as per the Economic Times.

130.title: India left with ordinary medium pacers: Aaqib Javed on Bumrah's injury
130.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Aaqib Javed said Team India's bowling for the T20 World Cup 2022 only comprises "ordinary medium pacers" after Jasprit Bumrah was ruled out. "Bumrah's absence is a big blow...You need someone who has an intimidating presence...India's form hasn't been great," added Javed. Javed had earlier stated that Team India should name Umran Malik as Bumrah's replacement.

131.title: Chhattisgarh announces 5% Dearness Allowance hike for govt employees
131.article_body: CM Bhupesh Baghel-led Chhattisgarh government announced a hike of 5% in the Dearness Allowance (DA) of the state government employees. The hike will be effective from October 1, 2022, and around 3.80 lakh state employees will benefit from it. With this hike in DA, those who receive salary under the 7th Pay Commission will now get 33%, an official said.

132.title: Man bites police dog while resisting arrest in Germany
132.article_body: German police on Friday said they have arrested a 29-year-old man for resisting arrest and biting a service dog. The incident happened after officers were called to a dispute between two 29-year-old men and a 35-year-old woman in Ginsheim-Gustavsburg town shortly after midnight. A police officer was injured during the incident after being punched by the woman in the face.

133.title: Traffic diversions at many places for Delhi Half Marathon on Sunday
133.article_body: Traffic restrictions will be placed at many locations in Delhi as the national capital is set to witness, after a gap of two years, a half marathon this Sunday. About 25,000 people are expected to participate in the Delhi Half Marathon. Traffic will be diverted at Aurobindo Marg-Lodhi Road Junction, Mathura Road-Bhairon Marg Junction and other places.

134.title: Turkish coal mine blast kills 25, leaves dozens trapped
134.article_body: At least 25 people have died and dozens remain trapped underground after an explosion in a coal mine in northern Turkey. A total of 110 workers were at the mine at the time of the explosion. Energy Minister Fatih Donmez said the initial indications were that the blast was caused by firedamp, a term referring to methane in coal mines.

135.title: 200 naked decomposing bodies found on rooftop of hospital in Pakistan
135.article_body: Over 200 decomposing bodies of people were found on a rooftop of a hospital in Pakistan's Punjab province, following which its CM ordered a committee to investigate the matter. Adviser to the Chief Minister Chaudhry Zaman Gujjar said, "All of the decomposing bodies were naked. Women's bodies were also not covered." The authorities ordered cremation of the bodies.

136.title: Suspect in US shooting that killed 5 identified as a 15-year-old boy
136.article_body: Police in North Carolina have said that the suspect involved in a shootout that killed five people on Thursday was a 15-year-old boy. The suspect, who is currently admitted in a hospital in critical condition, was taken into custody three hours after the shooting began in Raleigh's Hedingham neighbourhood. The motive behind the shooting is yet to be determined.

137.title: Will never ally with BJP again, will work for 'samajwadis': Bihar CM
137.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar has declared that he will never ally with the BJP again and said that he will stay with the 'samajwadis' and take the country forward. "The BJP is working to create conflict in the society…Those sitting at the Centre have nothing to do with the development…BJP people keep talking nonsense," said Kumar.

138.title: Electric car goes from zero to 100 kmph in 1.461 seconds in Germany, sets world record
138.article_body: An electric car in Germany has set the Guinness World Record for the fastest electric vehicle acceleration. The carbon racing car accelerated from zero to 100 kmph in 1.461 seconds, breaking the previous world record of 1.513 seconds. A 2021 formula student car designed by the University of Stuttgart's GreenTeam was used for the attempt to set the world record.

139.title: 100 students fall ill due to suspected gas leak at school in Tamil Nadu
139.article_body: Nearly 100 students suddenly fell sick allegedly due to a suspected gas leak from a septic tank on the premises of a school in Tamil Nadu's Hosur, an official said on Friday. A total of 67 students were hospitalised following the incident. Krishnagiri District Collector V Jaya Chandra Bhanu Reddy visited the school and hospital where students were being treated.

140.title: India reports 2,430 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 26,618
140.article_body: India reported 2,430 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,678 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 26,618. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,874 following 17 casualties in the last 24 hours.

141.title: Body of missing senior Maharashtra official found in Nira river
141.article_body: The body of Joint Director of Maharashtra Directorate of Marketing Shashikant Ghorpade, who went missing two days ago, was found in the Nira river on Friday, according to police. The police said that Ghorpade's car was found in front of a hotel near the bridge on the river. Ghorpade's family had filed a missing case in Satara.

142.title: US woman told to move dog on plane abuses cabin crew, hits man with bottle; video viral
142.article_body: A video of a woman abusing cabin crew of an Atlanta to New York flight after she was told to move her dog from her lap is going viral on social media. The video shows the woman throwing a bottle of water at a male passenger who told her to get off the flight. She was removed from the aircraft.

143.title: India will be thinking about T20 WC 2021 loss vs Pak: Suresh Raina
143.article_body: Suresh Raina said India will be thinking about their loss against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup 2021, while planning for their upcoming T20 World Cup 2022 match against the latter. "This game won't be easy for India," added Raina. "We need to set the tone [from] the first game, win against Pakistan and the...World Cup will follow," he stated.

144.title: 79% commuters support free bus travel in Bengaluru: Report
144.article_body: About 79% of bus commuters in Bengaluru support free travel, a report by Greenpeace India showed. Based on a survey of 558 people, the report titled 'Bustling Through Bengaluru' said that the majority of respondents were in favour of free bus travel, especially for women and students. About 45% of respondents want more buses to be added to the fleet.

145.title: Bajaj Auto Q2 profit rises 20% y-o-y to ₹1,530 cr, revenue up 16%
145.article_body: Bajaj Auto Limited reported a 20% increase in its standalone net profit for the quarter ended September at ₹1,530 crore as against ₹1,274.55 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. Its revenue from operations rose by 16% to ₹10,202.77 crore from ₹8,762.18 crore in the September quarter of FY22. The company's total sales increased by 0.6% to 11.51 lakh units.

146.title: Massive fire breaks out at auto parts manufacturing company in Gurugram
146.article_body: A massive fire broke out at an auto parts manufacturing company in Bilaspur Industrial area in Haryana's Gurugram on Saturday morning, officials said. No loss of life has been reported so far and the fire tenders are at the site. After hours of operations, the fire is yet to be doused completely, as per reports.

147.title: New ransomware 'Prestige' targeted Ukraine, Poland entities: Microsoft
147.article_body: Microsoft on Friday said it has detected new ransomware named 'Prestige' that targeted transportation and logistics companies in Ukraine and Poland. The ransomware was deployed on October 11 in attacks occurring within an hour of each other across all victims, Microsoft said. 'Prestige' encrypts a victim's data and asks them to purchase a decryption tool to unlock data, it added.

148.title: Murdoch considers merging Fox, News Corp nearly 10 yrs after split
148.article_body: Billionaire media mogul Rupert Murdoch is considering merging his News Corp and Fox Corporation, nearly a decade after the companies split. Both firms on Friday said they have formed special committees to review proposals for a potential combination. News Corp and Fox had market capitalisation of reportedly $9.31 billion and $16.84 billion, respectively, as of US market-close on Friday.

149.title: Saudi Arabia announces $400 million humanitarian aid to Ukraine
149.article_body: Saudi Arabia will provide $400 million in humanitarian aid to Ukraine amid the ongoing war, Saudi state news agency SPA said. Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman also spoke to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Friday. During the call, the Crown Prince expressed the Kingdom's readiness to continue efforts of mediation and support everything that contributes to de-escalation, SPA added.

150.title: Actress shares pic of her bruised face after being held by Iranian forces
150.article_body: Iranian actress Pantea Bahram has shared a picture of her bruised face after she was held by Iranian security forces for several days. The 52-year-old actress can be seen with a scar near her eye and one above her lips. This comes amid protests in Iran over 22-year-old Mahsa Amini's death after being detained by the country's morality police.

151.title: Shree Cement elevates MD Hari Mohan Bangur to Chairman's post
151.article_body: Shree Cement's board approved the elevation of Managing Director Hari Mohan Bangur to the Chairman's post with effect from October 15. Neeraj Akhoury, the former MD & CEO of ACC and Ambuja Cements, will be appointed as its Managing Director for five years. Chairman Benu Gopal Bangur has resigned and has been appointed as Chairman Emeritus of the company.

152.title: Shree Cement Q2 profit falls 67% y-o-y to ₹189 cr, revenue up 18%
152.article_body: Shree Cement reported a 67% decline in standalone net profit at ₹189 crore in the September quarter as against a profit of ₹578 crore in the corresponding period of FY22. The profit dropped 40% from ₹316 crore during the previous quarter on a sequential basis. The firm's standalone revenues increased by 18% to ₹3,781 crore year-on-year as against ₹3,206 crore.

153.title: Frozen or packed paratha different from roti, to attract 18% GST: Gujarat AAAR
153.article_body: Gujarat's Appellate Authority for Advance Ruling (AAAR) has ruled that frozen or packed parathas will attract a GST of 18% as opposed to plain chapati or roti, which attract 5% GST. The appellate authority noted that frozen or packed parathas are different from rotis and require three to four minutes of cooking till it turns golden brown on both sides.

154.title: Traffic diversions announced in Hyd for Venkateshwara Vaibhavotsavam
154.article_body: On the final day of the celebration of Sri Venkateshwara Vaibhavotsavam on Saturday, traffic diversions will remain in place between 3 pm to 10 pm near Hyderabad's NTR Stadium. "Traffic coming from Ashok Nagar will not be allowed towards NTR Stadium and will be diverted at Bakaram Bridge towards CGO Towers and Bansilalpet," said Hyderabad Traffic Police in an advisory.

155.title: Heavy rainfall causes waterlogging, traffic congestion in Pune
155.article_body: Some parts of Pune faced traffic congestion after roads got waterlogged due to heavy rainfall on Friday. Five tree-felling incidents were also reported from Kondhwa Budruk, Dhanori, Erandwane, Ganj Peth and Hadapsar areas in the city. India Meteorological Department (IMD) Pune official Anupam Kashyapi said, "Light rainfall is likely to continue in Pune for the next few days."

156.title: Woman kept in dog cage for 20 days after being kidnapped in Philippines, escapes
156.article_body: A Chinese woman escaped after allegedly being kidnapped during a night out and locked in a dog cage for 20 days in the Philippines. Following her disappearance, her boyfriend claimed to have received a ransom demand for $200,000 for her freedom. He was also sent a video that allegedly showed his girlfriend being beaten up by a baseball bat.

157.title: 3 arrested for smuggling mephedrone in Pune, 20.26 grams recovered
157.article_body: Pune City Police arrested three persons for allegedly smuggling and selling the banned drug mephedrone (MD). Police arrested two accused from the Lulla Nagar area after recovering 20.26 grams of MD worth ₹3 lakh from their possession. The third accused, who had allegedly provided the MD to the other two, was arrested later from Kondhwa.

158.title: 6 arrested for stabbing habitual offender to death in Hyderabad
158.article_body: Six people have been arrested for allegedly killing habitual offender Syed Bakhtiyar Agha Qureshi alias Agha shooter in Hyderabad. "On October 4, when Agha shooter reached behind Anmol hotel, the six arrested persons pounced on him and stabbed him to death with knives and daggers all of them were carrying," said DCP P Sai Chaitanya.

159.title: Over 40 rescued from Goa's Dudhsagar Falls after cable bridge collapses due to rain
159.article_body: Over 40 tourists were rescued from Goa's Dudhsagar Falls after a cable bridge collapsed due to heavy rain, as per an official statement. The incident took place on Friday evening when the water level at the waterfall rose amid heavy rain. "The River Lifesaver rescued around 40 guests...I thank and congratulate (them) for rescuing the tourists," CM Pramod Sawant tweeted.

160.title: Russia can destroy US, Europe within 30 minutes with nuclear missiles: Musk
160.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk on Saturday tweeted, "Russia has the ability to destroy USA and Europe utterly with nuclear missiles in less than 30 minutes and vice versa." He added that it would be "MAD" to use the nuclear weapons. Musk earlier said, "If we were dealing with reasonable people, we wouldn't have war in the first place."

161.title: Don't push nuclear-armed Russia into a corner, warns Belarus Prez
161.article_body: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko warned Ukraine and the West against forcing his ally Russia "into a corner", saying Moscow has nuclear weapons for a reason. "Russia has clearly outlined its position: God forbid there will be an attack on the territory of the Russian Federation; in that event, Russia can use all types of weapons if necessary," Lukashenko added.

162.title: House owner shoots suspected robber dead in Ghaziabad; case filed
162.article_body: A house owner shot dead a suspected robber after he along with others allegedly tried to enter the house and opened fire in Ghaziabad's Sahibabad on Friday, police said. The SSP said that incident occurred after the house owner "retaliated by firing from his licenced pistol". An FIR under IPC's Section 398 and 459 has been filed, an SHO said.

163.title: Bengaluru on yellow alert today, light to moderate rain till Oct 19
163.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a yellow alert for Bengaluru for Saturday, predicting 64.5 to 115.5 mm of rainfall. It added that the city is expected to witness light to moderate rain till October 19. Parts of the city, including Indiranagar, Mahadevapura and HSR Layout, saw waterlogging after 66 mm of rainfall on Friday.

164.title: 5-foot-long checkered keelback snake spotted at Amit Shah's house
164.article_body: A five-foot-long checkered keelback, commonly known as Asiatic water snake, was spotted at Union Home Minister Amit Shah's residence on Thursday. "Geared with rescue equipment, a two-member rescue team rushed to the snake's aid...We are grateful to the security personnel working in the Union Home Minister's residence for alerting Wildlife SOS to this emergency," Wildlife SOS said.

165.title: Tata Power hit by cyberattack, says 'all critical operational systems functioning'
165.article_body: Tata Power has confirmed that it was hit by a cyberattack that impacted some of its IT systems. "[We have] taken steps to retrieve and restore the systems. All critical operational systems are functioning," the power generation company wrote in a statement to stock exchanges. Tata Power has restricted access for employee and customer facing portals as a precautionary measure.

166.title: Rickshaw driver killed, 2 others injured in multi-vehicle crash in Delhi
166.article_body: A 40-year-old rickshaw driver died and two others were injured after an RTV (Rural Transport Vehicle) bus, a rickshaw, an auto-rickshaw and a motorcycle crashed near Kalkaji Depot in Delhi's Okhla, police said. The RTV driver lost balance and hit other vehicles, police added. The 26-year-old driver was apprehended on the spot, police further said.

167.title: He was one of the funniest people I've met: Daniel Radcliffe on Robbie Coltrane's demise
167.article_body: Daniel Radcliffe, who portrayed the titular role in the 'Harry Potter' films, mourned the demise of Robbie Coltrane, who portrayed Hagrid. "Robbie was one of the funniest people I've met and used to keep us laughing constantly as kids on the set," Radcliffe said. "He was an incredible actor and a lovely man," he added.

168.title: Bangladesh make 2 last-minute changes to their T20 World Cup 2022 squad
168.article_body: Bangladesh have made two last-minute changes to their T20 World Cup 2022 squad after the tri-series in New Zealand. Soumya Sarkar and Shoriful Islam have been included in the final 15-member group. The duo replace Sabbir Rahman and Mohammad Saifuddin in the squad. Both Shoriful and Sarkar were initially named in the reserves for the tournament.

169.title: India briefs G-20 countries on its agenda ahead of presidency
169.article_body: India has briefed the member nations of the G20 on the agenda that New Delhi will be pursuing when it assumes the grouping's rotating presidency next year. Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and Reserve Bank of India Governor Shaktikanta Das elaborated on India's agenda during a G20 leaders meeting in Washington on Thursday. Details of the agenda were not disclosed.

170.title: Russian man detained in Norway admits to illegally flying drones
170.article_body: A 50-year-old Russian man, who was detained in Arctic Norway earlier in the week, has admitted to illegally flying two drones in Norwegian airspace over areas potentially with critical energy infrastructure. The man was produced in a Norwegian court on Friday and was sent to two weeks in custody. Three passports (two Russian and one Israeli) were recovered from him.

171.title: Should create a gas exchange market in Turkey: Putin to Erdogan
171.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has proposed that a natural gas exchange market be set up in Turkey. "We could consider building another gas pipeline...in Turkey for sale to third countries, especially in Europe," he said, adding that the hub "will be an international distribution centre". He made the comments during a meeting with his Turkish counterpart Recep Erdogan.

172.title: Pakistan make 1 change to their T20 World Cup 2022 squad, replace Qadir with Fakhar
172.article_body: Pakistan have made a change to their T20 World Cup 2022 squad, with standby batter Fakhar Zaman being promoted to the 15-player main squad. He has replaced leg-spinner Usman Qadir. Qadir hasn't played for Pakistan since he hurt his thumb while fielding during the fourth T20I against England last month and he is yet to recover.

173.title: Files of 27 yrs of corruption burnt in Guj: Cong on Old Secretariat fire
173.article_body: The Congress has alleged that the fire that broke out at Gujarat's Old Secretariat on Friday was an attempt by the BJP to burn government files to hide corruption ahead of the state Assembly elections. "The BJP is aware of going out of power...In this panic, the files of 27 years of corruption are being burnt," the party added.

174.title: TMC's Sudip Bandyopadhyay compromised with BJP: TMC MLA
174.article_body: TMC MLA Tapas Roy on Friday accused TMC MP Sudip Bandyopadhyay of "compromising" with "opposition BJP". Calling Bandyopadhyay a "white elephant", the senior TMC leader added, "What has been his role in the Parliament, apart from praising Prime Minister Narendra Modi's dress?"
