349.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge, who will be contesting the party's Presidential election, told Indian Express during an interview that "without the Gandhis, you can't (operate)…you have to take their guidance". Kharge said this on being asked about how a "non-Gandhi presidency" would work. "[Gandhi's] have sacrificed for this country. Even the positions (they have taken)," he further said.

350.title: Chivas Regal maker's India head steps down due to health reasons
350.article_body: Chivas Regal maker Pernod Ricard's India head, Thibault Cuny, has stepped down from his role due to health reasons, the French spirits giant said. The company said Cuny will take a break from his professional duties but will stay on with Pernod. Cuny took over as the Managing Director and CEO of Pernod Ricard South Asia in 2019.

351.title: NASA shares pic of dust 'fingerprint' created by 2 stars that meet once every 8 years
351.article_body: NASA has released a picture of "fingerprint-like pattern" formed by two giant stars that come together about once every eight years. The image, captured by James Webb Space Telescope, shows at least 17 concentric dust rings. Each ring was created when the two stars came close together and their stellar winds met, compressing the gas and forming dust, NASA said.

352.title: US-based 6sense fires 150 workers globally, including India: Report
352.article_body: US-based AI firm 6sense has fired close to 150 employees globally, including India, citing uncertain macroeconomic conditions, Moneycontrol reported. The layoffs happened across teams including content, design, sales and marketing. Employees were reportedly offered to encash privilege leaves as part of severance package. The Tiger Global-backed company is currently valued at $5.2 billion.

353.title: S Korea scrambles jets as 10 N Korean military aircraft fly close to border
353.article_body: South Korea scrambled fighter jets after 10 North Korean military aircraft flew close to the border dividing two countries, South Korean Joint Chiefs of Staff said in a statement. The North Korean aircraft were flying 25 km north of the Military Demarcation Line. The statement added that South Korean air force conducted an emergency sortie and maintained a response posture.

354.title: Expected justice, not verdict from SC: Student expelled over hijab
354.article_body: Udupi student Aliya Assadi, who was expelled for wearing hijab, said she was expecting justice from the Supreme Court, not the split verdict that came. Assadi was among the first to challenge the hijab ban in Karnataka High Court. Assadi appreciated Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia's remarks saying it "represented our struggle, allowing us to get our education with our constitutional values".

355.title: Prithvi Shaw smashes highest T20 score by an Indian in 2022
355.article_body: Mumbai opener Prithvi Shaw on Friday smashed the highest T20 score by an Indian in 2022. The 22-year-old slammed 134(61), including 13 fours and nine sixes, against Assam in Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. The previous highest T20 score by an Indian in 2022 was registered by Karnataka opener Devdutt Padikkal, who slammed 124*(62) against Maharashtra on Tuesday.

356.title: Young boy sits on pilot's seat, holds control wheel of moving plane in Guj; video viral
356.article_body: A video showing a young boy sitting on a pilot's seat and holding the control wheel of a moving aircraft reportedly at Surat airport in Gujarat is going viral online. The aircraft, which is believed to be a single-engine plane, can be seen moving on a runway while the boy takes instructions from the pilot sitting next to him.

357.title: At least 11 killed, dozens injured in bus explosion in Mali
357.article_body: At least 11 people were killed and dozens were injured in an explosion on a bus in central Mali on Thursday, according to a hospital source. The bus hit an explosive device while travelling the road between Bandiagara and Goundaka, in the Mopti area, known as a hotbed for jihadist violence. Mali has been fighting Islamist insurgency since 2012.

358.title: 2 more minors file POCSO case against rape-accused seer Shivamurthy Murugha
358.article_body: Karnataka Police registered a POCSO case against seer Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru, Sri Murugha Mutt's chief pontiff, as two more minors have accused him of rape and sexual assault. Police have registered an FIR against seven people. The seer was earlier arrested after two minors, studying and staying at the Mutt's hostel in Chitradurga, accused him of rape and sexual assault.

359.title: Doctor removes 23 contact lenses from woman's eye who 'forgot' to take them off in US
359.article_body: A doctor in US' California removed 23 contact lenses from an eye of a patient and shared a video of the procedure on Instagram. "A rare occasion when someone 'forgot' to remove contact lenses at night and kept on putting a new one in every morning. 23 days in a row," the doctor wrote in her post.

360.title: UP minister's nephew held for trying to ram car into restaurant staff
360.article_body: Uttar Pradesh minister Arun Kumar's nephew who allegedly tried to ram his car into a group of restaurant workers in Bareilly has been arrested, police said on Friday. The incident occurred after the restaurant staff apparently refused to serve the accused. "The police must act as per the law, and there should be no laxity on this," Kumar told PTI.

361.title: Infosys shares surge 5% after Q2 results, ₹9,300-cr buyback news
361.article_body: A day after Infosys reported an 11.1% year-on-year surge in quarterly net profit at ₹6,021 crore, its shares rose by 5% on Friday. At 11:10 am, Infosys' stock was trading 5.11% higher at ₹ 1,492.30 apiece on the BSE. Its revenue from operations surged 23.4% to ₹36,538 crore. Infosys will also buy back shares worth ₹9,300 crore to reward shareholders.

362.title: BJP leader fined ₹800 for defying govt order after Akhlaq lynching
362.article_body: A fine of ₹800 has been imposed on BJP leader Sangeet Som after he was found guilty of violating the government's order in Uttar Pradesh's Bisahda village following Mohammad Akhlaq's lynching in 2015. Som had reportedly addressed a crowd of over hundreds of people in the wake of Akhlaq's death while CrPC Section 144 was in place in the area.

363.title: Turkish MP smashes phone with hammer in Parliament to protest new media bill
363.article_body: A Turkish lawmaker smashed his mobile phone with a hammer while speaking in Parliament. Burak Erbay, a member of the opposition Republican People's Party, was protesting against a proposed government-backed bill that aims to combat online "disinformation". As per the legislation, journalists and social media users could be jailed for up to three years for spreading fake news.

364.title: Lifestyle's new campaign aims to inspire customers to groove in style
364.article_body: Lifestyle announced the launch of its festive campaign that aims to encourage fashion lovers to elevate their style with the brand's new collection ahead of the seasonal celebrations. Shoppers will get a Portico bedsheet worth ₹2,499 for ₹799* on minimum shopping of ₹5,000 along with 10% cashback with HDFC cards on shopping worth ₹7,500*.

365.title: World's first space tourist Dennis Tito, his wife buy tickets to fly around Moon
365.article_body: Dennis Tito, who became the world's first-ever space tourist in 2001, and his wife Akiko have purchased two tickets on SpaceX's Starship rocket to fly around the Moon on a week-long mission. The couple paid an undisclosed amount and will travel with 10 other passengers. At 82, Tito could become the oldest person to go into orbit and deep space.

366.title: Superspreader of lies: Jairam after Shah blames Nehru for J&K issue
366.article_body: After Union Minister Amit Shah blamed former PM Jawaharlal Nehru's "mistake" of inserting Article 370 for the "mess" in Jammu and Kashmir, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said, "Nehru didn't dictatorially insert Article 370...It was discussed, unlike notebandi (demonetisation)." He added that Shah is "as much a superspreader of lies as his Saheb". "Nobody resigned over it," he further said.

367.title: Man stabs wife to death over daughter's disobedience in Ghaziabad
367.article_body: A case was filed after a man allegedly stabbed his wife to death after getting infuriated over his daughter's disobedience in Ghaziabad's Masuri, police said on Thursday. The man had asked his daughter to get a bedsheet but she didn't as she was playing, Additional SP (Rural) Iraj Raja said. The wife succumbed to her injuries during treatment, Raja added.

368.title: Dera chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh granted 40-day parole
368.article_body: Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh has been granted parole for 40 days. He is currently serving prison sentence in Haryana's Sunaria jail. The move has come ahead of upcoming Adampur bypolls. He had earlier come out of prison in February and June. He is serving a 20-year jail term for raping two women in his Sirsa ashram.

369.title: Iraqi Parliament elects Abdul Latif Rashid as new President
369.article_body: Lawmakers in Iraq on Thursday elected Abdul Latif Rashid as the country's new President, paving the way for the formation of a new government and ending a year of deadlock after October 2021 election. Soon after being elected, Rashid named Mohamed Shia al-Sudani as PM. Thursday's vote took place shortly after at least nine rockets landed around Baghdad's Green Zone.

370.title: Meta seeks dismissal of US FTC lawsuit over VR company acquisition
370.article_body: Meta on Thursday asked a federal court to dismiss a lawsuit filed by the US Federal Trade Commission (FTC) against its proposed acquisition of California-based VR firm Within Unlimited and its fitness app Supernatural. The lawsuit, filed in July, said the deal would hurt competition in VR fitness market. Meta said the lawsuit is "ill-conceived" and "relies on pure speculation".

371.title: AAP has an old habit of doing drama: CT Ravi on Gopal Italia's remark
371.article_body: Reacting to AAP leader Gopal Italia's recent remark against temples, BJP leader CT Ravi criticised the party and said that the AAP has an old habit of doing drama. "The people of Gujarat are intelligent, they know that AAP is doing drama...The Gujaratis have always been with PM Modi and they will be in the future also," said Ravi.

372.title: Karnataka-proposed EV hub to house 1,000 startups: Ashwath Narayan
372.article_body: Karnataka government's proposed EV industry hub will house about 1,000 startups, Minister of Information Technology and Biotechnology, CN Ashwath Narayan said. While addressing a conference, Narayan said five centres will be set up to facilitate training, research, development, innovation and entrepreneurship. The state will become a premier hub of EVs in a couple of years, he added.

373.title: Meta's Product Design VP Margaret Stewart to leave after 10 years
373.article_body: Meta's VP of Product Design Margaret Stewart will leave the company after over 10 years. Notably, Stewart also led Meta's now-dissolved Responsible Innovation team that focused on identifying potential harms of the firm's products. Announcing her departure, Stewart said she was "sad" that the team was reorganised but remains hopeful that its work will "continue to influence" what Meta builds.

374.title: US interest rates may go over 4.5% to tame inflation: JPMorgan CEO
374.article_body: America's largest bank JPMorgan Chase's CEO Jamie Dimon warned that US policymakers might have to increase interest rates to more than 4.5% to tame inflation amid a looming recession. Dimon said quantitative tightening and fragile energy supply could lead to an uncertain future. "It's bad...those things are huge turbulence...that can easily cause a recession," Dimon further said.

375.title: India's 5G is indigenous and can be provided to other nations: FM
375.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the 5G technology in India is completely indigenous except for some "critical parts" that have been imported. "There could be some critical parts coming from, say, countries like (South) Korea, but certainly not from somebody else. So complete indigenous technology that we can now provide 5G (to any country) who wants it," Sitharaman said.

376.title: Teen girl who worked in Bengaluru dies after getting molested in bus
376.article_body: A 19-year-old girl, who started her first job only two months ago in Bengaluru, died after getting molested in a moving bus while travelling to her hometown Belagavi, said police. She had bite marks on her lips and neck, along with cigarette burns and head injuries, an officer said. "She was assaulted, but she was not raped," said Belagavi ACP.

377.title: Asian govts spent $50 bn forex reserves in Sept amid rising dollar: Report
377.article_body: Asian governments spent about $50 billion in foreign exchange reserves in September, which is the highest since March 2020, amid surging US dollar, according to Exante Data Inc. Emerging Asian countries, excluding China, spent nearly $30 billion in dollar sales in the spot market in September, while the figure rose to $50 billion with the inclusion of Japan, Exante said.

378.title: Iftikhar plays like MS Dhoni but can't finish like Dhoni did: Ajmal
378.article_body: Former Pakistan spinner Saeed Ajmal said Pakistan batter Iftikhar Ahmad bats like MS Dhoni but cannot finish like Dhoni used to. "Dhoni used to take singles and hit sixes towards the end to compensate...Iftikhar plays 10 dot balls...and when...[he tries] to recover by hitting big shots...[he gets] out," added Ajmal. "Where do you stand?" he stated.

379.title: ED raids 25 locations in national capital in Delhi excise policy case
379.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday raided about 25 locations in the national capital as part of its money laundering case investigation in connection with the now-scrapped Delhi excise policy. The locations raided belong to private entities linked to liquor dealerships and distributorships, officials said. Earlier, ED raided about 35 locations in Delhi and Punjab in connection with the case.

380.title: Over 600 Russia-annexed settlements liberated in past month: Ukraine
380.article_body: Ukrainian soldiers have liberated more than 600 Russia-occupied settlements, including 75 in Kherson region, in the past month, Ukraine's Ministry for Reintegration of the Temporary Occupied Territories said. More than 500 settlements were liberated in Kharkiv, 43 in Donetsk and seven in Luhansk. Russia recently annexed four Ukrainian regions including Kherson, Donetsk, Luhansk and Zaporizhzhia.

381.title: Ammunition depot near border destroyed in Ukraine strikes: Russia
381.article_body: The governor of a Russian border region, Belgorod, has accused Ukraine of shelling an apartment building and blowing up an ammunition depot. No one was hurt in the attacks, Governor Vyacheslav Gladkov added. Meanwhile, Ukraine has denied Moscow's claim and said Russia had launched a missile toward Ukraine's Kharkiv city but "something went wrong and it hit [the] residential building".

382.title: Pune man arrested for vehicle thefts, 16 stolen two-wheelers seized
382.article_body: Pune City Police arrested a 26-year-old man for allegedly committing vehicle thefts and recovered 16 stolen two-wheelers from him. About 200 CCTV cameras were checked and police got clues that led them to the accused, a press release stated. Police laid a trap and nabbed the man at the red light area in Budhwar Peth's Dane Ali.

383.title: Audience blasted with weed smoke from fog machine during rapper's performance in US
383.article_body: Audience at Kushstock Festival in US' California was recently blasted with weed smoke from fog machines during rapper Chucky Chuck's performance. A video shared by the rapper shows smoke coming out of the two cannabis cannons operated by a man on the stage while Chuck performs. The crowd can be heard cheering.

384.title: Development of K'taka took a back seat due to Cong's rule: Bommai
384.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai criticised Congress and said that the development of the state took a back seat due to Congress' 50 years of rule. "The Congress party has been doing Bharat Jodo Yatra...They cannot even implement pro-people policies but have indulged in power politics...The people will permanently send them back home in 2023," said Bommai.

385.title: TMC wants to remove Hindus from certain areas of Kolkata: Suvendu Adhikari
385.article_body: Talking about the Mominpur violence, BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari criticised the ruling TMC and alleged that the party wants to remove Hindus from certain areas of Kolkata. "This is CM Mamata Banerjee's vote bank politics. The Hindu vote is going towards the BJP and CM Banerjee is taking minority votes by threatening and doing communal campaigns," said Adhikari.

386.title: 2 on way to celebrate birthday killed in car accident in Mumbai, 7 injured
386.article_body: Two boys, aged 26 and 18, died in a car accident while they were on their way to celebrate someone's birthday. Seven others were also injured in the incident. One of the boys said that the car's tyre burst while they were on their way, following which, the driver lost control of the vehicle.

387.title: Beauty contest poster offers winner chance to marry NRI; Punjab police shares post
387.article_body: Posters of a beauty contest advertising that the winning girl will be given a chance to marry a Canadian NRI have been put up in Punjab's Bathinda. Sharing the poster, Bathinda Police tweeted, "Taking Swift action Bathinda Police registered FIR & action is being taken against the guilty persons. Violation of law will not be tolerated at any cost."

388.title: No jeans, T-shirts in class: Muzaffarnagar official warns teachers
388.article_body: Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar administration has issued a circular warning teachers of all government schools and colleges against wearing jeans and T-shirts in classrooms as it may give a "wrong impression" to students. "It is a matter of discipline," said District Inspector of Schools (DIOS) Gajendra Kumar Singh. Female teachers need to wear saree or salwar-kameez, he added.

389.title: Snap employee data exposed after breach at a document firm: Report
389.article_body: Messaging app Snap has reported that its employees' data was exposed by a breach at a third-party document analysis firm, Elevate, Reuters reported. Elevate reportedly told Snap that an unauthorised party had accessed some of its computer systems in March 2022. According to a letter to a former employee, information including name, address and employment history may have been affected.

390.title: Uttarakhand BJP MLA apologises for 'patao goddesses' remark
390.article_body: Uttarakhand BJP MLA Bansidhar Bhagat on Thursday apologised for his 'patao goddesses' remark that he made on the International Day of the Girl Child earlier this week. "My intentions were pure. By saying 'patao', I just meant coaxing the goddesses for their blessings. Still, if my words have hurt anyone, I take them back," he said.

391.title: Spain newspaper uses snake charmer cartoon for India, Zerodha CEO calls it 'an insult'
391.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath has criticised a Spanish newspaper for using the caricature of a snake charmer to represent India. He shared a picture of La Vanguardia's front page on Twitter, which showed the caricature with the headline, "The Hour of the Indian Economy". Kamath said, "Quite cool that the world is taking notice, but the cultural caricaturing...is an insult."

392.title: Duo who cheated 600 to 700 people on pretext of jobs held in Noida
392.article_body: Two men who were operating from an office in Noida were arrested for allegedly cheating 600 to 700 people by forging fake passports, visas and tickets for them under the pretext of providing them jobs in the Gulf area. The accused's modus operandi was to set up a fake company and then collect ₹65,000 to ₹1 lakh from the applicants.

393.title: Tiger allegedly seen at Pune's Sinhagad Fort; forest dept on alert
393.article_body: A couple claimed on Thursday that they spotted a tiger at Pune's Sinhagad Fort. Deputy Conservator of Forests (Territorial) Pune Rahul Patil said that the forest department is verifying the claim. A police inspector said that a team was rushed to the spot after being informed about the claim and people in the vicinity were warned as a precautionary measure.

394.title: Probe started, will investigate all rumours: Police on Kerala human sacrifice
394.article_body: Kochi Deputy Commissioner of Police S Sasidharan has said that the investigation into the Kerala human sacrifice case has started and that all rumours will be probed. "It is progressing. We will decide on evidence collection soon. We haven't decided the date and time of evidence collection," he added. Police said that the accused allegedly lured victims with money.

395.title: 3-year-old boy found with grandmother's body in Ghaziabad's Modinagar
395.article_body: A three-year-old boy was found with his 58-year-old grandmother's body in Ghaziabad's Modinagar on Thursday, police said. Prima facie, she appeared to have suffered a head injury, police added. "When I reached my mother's house to pick up my son...I found her dead with injuries on the head...my son crying by the side of her body," the deceased's son said.

396.title: India reports 2,678 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 26,583
396.article_body: India reported 2,678 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,786 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 26,583. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,857 following 10 casualties in the last 24 hours.

397.title: Apple ordered to sell iPhones with charger by Brazil court, fined ₹156 crore
397.article_body: A Brazilian court on Thursday fined Apple 100 million reais (around ₹156 crore) and ruled that battery chargers must come with new iPhones sold in the country. The lawsuit filed by an association of borrowers, consumers and taxpayers argued that the company commits abusive practices by selling its flagship product without a charger. Apple said it will appeal the decision.

398.title: Bandhan Bank onboards Sourav Ganguly as brand ambassador
398.article_body: Bandhan Bank has announced Sourav Ganguly as its brand ambassador. Fondly called 'Dada' and 'Maharaja of Indian Cricket', Sourav Ganguly will be the voice of Bandhan Bank, helping the brand take its message to the masses. "This association is another step towards connecting strongly with consumers across the spectrum and reinforcing our ongoing mission of inclusive banking," the brand stated.

399.title: Set your house in order instead of lecturing: India after Pak raises Kashmir issue
399.article_body: After Pakistan accused India of committing atrocities in Jammu and Kashmir at the CICA summit in Astana, MoS for External Affairs Meenakashi Lekhi said, "Pakistan's remarks...constitute gross interference in India's internal affairs." She added, "With its own record of...dismal treatment of minority communities, Pakistan would be well advised to set its house in order instead of lecturing."

400.title: Turkey introduces jail terms for 'disinformation'
400.article_body: Turkish Parliament has passed a new media bill that could see reporters and social media users jailed for up to three years for spreading "disinformation". The Council of Europe said the new measure's vague definition of "disinformation" and the accompanying threat of jail could have a "chilling effect and increased self-censorship, not least in view of the upcoming elections in...2023".
